meanings.definition: The act of carrying out or putting into effect a plan, order, or course of action.
meanings.sent1: The executions of the new safety protocols went smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The executions of the project tasks were completed ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent3: The executions of the surprise birthday party made everyone jump with joy.
meanings.sent4: The executions of the marketing campaign were like a well-choreographed dance.
meanings.sent5: The executions of the evacuation plan were practiced until perfect.

meanings.definition: The act of putting to death as a legal penalty.
meanings.sent1: The executions of the criminals were carried out in the early morning.
meanings.sent2: The executions of the condemned prisoners took place in the town square.
meanings.sent3: The executions of the mischievous cartoon characters in the movie were quite dramatic.
meanings.sent4: The executions of the enemy's strategy were swift and decisive.
meanings.sent5: The executions of the condemned pirates were a grim reminder of justice.
